context: Monte Carlo percentile bands are frequentist simulation outputs, not Bayesian posteriors.
Intervals around future observations should be labeled prediction/forecast intervals.

original_phrase: KPSS fails to reject stationarity in levels (p=0.10)
replacement_phrase: KPSS fails to reject the null of level-stationarity (p ≥ 0.10)
context: Statsmodels reports 0.10 as an upper bound; also state KPSS null explicitly.

replacement_phrase: KPSS does not reject level-stationarity at 5% for nd_intl_migration (p ≥ 0.10)
context: Robustness table/narrative must match the actual p-values for the same series/specification.

original_phrase: ADF proves a unit root / series is non-stationary
replacement_phrase: ADF does not reject a unit root (low power in n=15)
context: Failing to reject H0 is not proof; hedge language.

original_phrase: The series is a random walk without drift
replacement_phrase: ARIMA(0,1,0) was selected by AIC within a limited search; treated as a baseline model
context: Model-selection in n=15 cannot establish the DGP; avoid definitive claims.
Replace “optimal” with “selected” and note model uncertainty.

original_phrase: 8% annual growth from the 2024 baseline (5,126) yields ~19,318 by 2045
replacement_phrase: Scenario applies 10% above ARIMA for 2025–2029, then 8% growth from 2030–2045; 2045 ≈ 19,318
context: Arithmetic is correct under the implemented hybrid rule, but the label “8% from baseline” is inaccurate.

replacement_phrase: If truly compounding from 2024 for 21 years: 5126×1.08^21 ≈ 25,803
context: Clarify the intended formula; do not conflate with the implemented hybrid rule.

original_phrase: Continue 2010–2019 slope (+72/year) from 2024 baseline gives 2,517 in 2045
replacement_phrase: Pre-2020 trend scenario is anchored at 2019 value (634) and adds 72.43/year; 2045 ≈ 2,517
context: Explains why the path is below the 2024 observed level; fix scenario note/description.

replacement_phrase: Monte Carlo output implies CV_2045 ≈ 0.39 (sd/mean of simulated 2045 outcomes); historical CV ≈ 0.825
context: Distinguish historical descriptive CV from forecast-distribution CV; clarify whether CV is an input or a diagnostic.

original_phrase: Unit root tests establish integration order I(1)
replacement_phrase: Unit root/stationarity tests are suggestive only; breaks/outliers can mimic I(1) in small samples
context: Replace strong identification claims with cautious interpretation.

replacement_phrase: Data-driven break detection found no break under BIC/penalty; targeted Chow tests indicate significant break at 2020/2021
context: With n=15, break tests have low power; reconcile contradictory break evidence.

original_phrase: COVID outlier is -1.2 SD so not an outlier
replacement_phrase: 2020 is a time-series intervention/outlier despite not tripping IQR rules; handle via dummy/robust model
context: IQR-based outlier detection is not the right tool for time-series shocks.
Terminology should describe what is computed (percentiles of simulated paths).
Specify which stationarity concept is tested (KPSS regression='c' vs 'ct').

replacement_phrase: suggests / is consistent with / illustrates (hedged claim)
context: General tone correction for small-sample inference.
